title: Cisco Reimagined
description: An internal web platform designed to modernize Ciscoâ€™s customer interaction workflows using the Khoros suite. Improved operational efficiency, UI experience, and cross-team collaboration.
responsibilities: Developed responsive UI screens using JavaScript, jQuery, SCSS, and Freemarker templates.

title: Cisco Techzone
description: A knowledge-sharing and content-publishing platform for Cisco engineers and product teams. The platform enables employees to upload, edit, and publish technical content securely.
responsibilities: Developed new features using Java, Spring Boot, React.js, and MySQL.
Built dynamic pages with React components and optimized rendering performance.
Created shell scripts for automated deployment and environment setup.
Integrated secure access control using RBAC and Cisco-internal authentication.
Built custom dashboards for analytics and content insights.
Improved search performance with database indexing and query optimization.
Implemented CI/CD automation using Jenkins for multi-environment deployment.
Collaborated directly with Cisco content teams to refine workflows and UI experiences.

title: AutoDesk User Automation
description: A backend automation project for managing user cleanup, permission removal, and access revocation to maintain system security and reduce manual administrative effort.
responsibilities: Developed automated cleanup scripts using Java and shell scripting.
Implemented RBAC logic to manage user permissions and restrict unauthorized access.
Developed scheduled background jobs for daily, weekly, and monthly user audits.
Integrated monitoring logs with ELK to track execution and detect failures.
Automated email notifications for completed actions and exceptions.
Enhanced the reliability of the automation by adding retry mechanisms and error handling.
Participated in security reviews and improved the audit compliance process.

title: Khoros to Aurora Migration
description: Major migration project involving database transition from MySQL to Amazon Aurora, along with complete frontend modernization using React and GraphQL.
responsibilities: Designed and developed GraphQL schemas, resolvers, and backend connectors.
Migrated large-scale datasets from MySQL to Aurora with zero downtime.
Implemented ETL scripts and automated data validation workflows.
Optimized database queries, reducing API response time by 40%.
Rebuilt entire frontend using React.js with modular components and reusable hooks.
Integrated AWS services (Lambda, RDS, CloudWatch) for scalable deployment.
Performed regression testing, performance testing, and production rollout.
Collaborated closely with DevOps teams to streamline deployments and CI/CD automation.

title: Internal Developer Portal
description: A centralized portal designed for internal teams to manage builds, deployments, logs, and microservice health checks seamlessly.
responsibilities: Developed microservice dashboards and live monitoring screens.
Integrated CI/CD metrics and build logs into React UI using REST and WebSockets.
Added role-based access for developers, managers, and administrators.
Created dark/light theme UI and improved overall UX using design patterns.
Reduced manual DevOps dependency by automating triggers and deployment actions.
Implemented advanced filtering, search, and analytics charts.

title: API Performance Optimization Suite
description: A toolkit for analyzing, profiling, and optimizing slow APIs across multiple microservices for better backend performance.
responsibilities: Analyzed API bottlenecks using profiling tools and SQL explain plans.
Implemented caching layers using Redis and in-memory optimizations.
Reduced API latency from 700ms to under 200ms through query refactoring.
Built dashboards to display real-time API metrics and SLA breaches.
Improved failover handling and circuit breaker configurations using resilience patterns.
